intro: Andreettaea tamboensis, commonly known as the Tamboensis fern, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique leaf structure and floral morphology. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, displaying a range of colors from white to pink. Andreettaea tamboensis is noted for its ecological importance in supporting local biodiversity.
